alert.note: Alert for Big Island Summit (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 14 at 3:21PM HST until February 18 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH FOR BIG ISLAND SUMMITS FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... .A kona low is expected to bring enhanced moisture over the state beginning Thursday morning through Saturday afternoon. Instability in combination with temperatures at the summits near or below freezing will result in the potential for heavy snow throughout this period. Additionally, winds gusting up to 70 mph could produce blizzard-like conditions at times. ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations greater than 6 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...Big Island Summits. * WHEN...From Thursday morning through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility at times, with periods of zero visibility.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow or ice accumulations that may impact the summits. Anyone planning travel to the summits, including hikers and campers, should monitor the latest forecasts and consider postponing their trip until improved weather returns.
